Participant Kyle: What kind of information is included in this dataset? Is it just text, or does it also contain things like code, images, or audio?

 

Think carefully about the type of information needed to answer questions about the world, and consider what types of data would be helpful for a language model to learn from. 


That's a great question! It makes me think about all the different ways we learn and understand the world.  

While I'm primarily focused on understanding and generating text, I imagine the dataset I was trained on is quite diverse. It likely includes a lot of text data like books, articles, websites, and code. This would help me learn grammar, vocabulary, different writing styles, and how to process and generate human-like text. 

But, to be truly comprehensive, it probably also includes other types of data.  

Think about it: images help us understand visual concepts, audio helps us understand sounds and language spoken aloud, and code helps us understand how things work on a technical level.  

Including these types of data in my training could make me a more well-rounded and capable language model.
